content.description: Climb a broken corner to gain a ledge at the base of a splitter.  Continue up the splitter via fists and OW.
content.location:
This is just right of

Pigs We Get

.

content.description: Climb a slab up to a ledge, and set sail up the technical arete.  The climbing eases past the 4th bolt but is still very good.
content.location: This is the obvious, bolted arete in the middle of the wall.

content.description: This is a great route that requires some crack climbing technique.  Begin up an easy unprotected slab to gain a ledge at the bottom of a splitter.  Climb the splitter above that narrows from thin hands to less than tips, and thank jeebus for the face features that appear just in time.  Pull up into a left-trending, awkward hand crack and finish up the face on jugs to gain the chains.
content.protection:
#0.3-3.0 Camalots, 2 bolt anchor shared with

Slave Screams

.

content.description:
This is a fun route that climbs a prominent pillar via discontinuous cracks and face.  There is some hollow rock, so be deliberate with gear placements.  There is definitely an "alpine feel" to this route.

Begin in a small, left-facing corner that opens to fingers at ~10 feet.  Delicately climb through some hollow, blocky terrain to gain a left-trending, fingers flake.  Continue up and left onto the face following the flake until you reach a good stance below a small roof.  Clip a bolt, and climb the face above passing another bolt before arriving at the chains.
content.protection: Thin-fat fingers, 2 bolts, and a helmet.
content.location:
This is 50 feet right of

Trail of Honey

.

content.description:
Climb the 1st 15 feet of

Fountain of Decay

, and continue straight up on easy terrain to a thin hands splitter that works its way up the edge of the arete.  When the splitter ends, plug in a #1 Camalot into a horizontal pod and climb up and left to the

Fountain

chains.
content.protection: Fingers through thin hands, several #1 Camalots.
content.location: This is the right-most route on the wall.

content.description: This is another great trad line that begins up an easy unprotected slab to gain a ledge at the base of a thin, left-facing corner.  Layback and stem up the pumpy corner with tricky, small gear until the crack opens up to fingers. Charge up to a jug where the crack trends left, and finish on left-trending hands and jugs to the chains.
content.location:
This is just right of

Halos

.

content.description: Begin on a slabby face, and climb up to a good ledge at the base of the splitter.  Continue up via wide hands and fists with face features to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the left-most route on the wall.
